suncertify.db
Interface Table

All Known Implementing Classes:
CombinedTable
public interface Table

A database table. Classes that implement this interface should be thread safe.

Method Summary
 void addExistingRecord(Record existingRecord)
          Add an existing Record to the table, for example when populating the table from a database file.
 void addModifiedRecord(Record newRecord)
          Add a Record to the table, and write it to file.
 void addToDeleteList(int recordNumber)
          Add the record number of a deleted Record to the delete list so that the number can be reused when a new Record is created.
 Record createRecord(java.util.List<Field> fields)
          Create a Record from the given fields, and add it to the table.
 java.util.Collection<LockableRecord> getAllRecords()
          Get all the records, together with their locks.
 FieldParsers getFieldParsers()
          Get the parsers for the fields in this Table.
 Record getRecord(int recordNumber)
          Get the Record with the given number, or null if not found.
 TableSchema getSchema()
          Get the schema for this Table.
 void shutDown()
          Shuts down the Table gracefully, ensuring that the data file does not become corrupted.
 

Method Detail

addExistingRecord

void addExistingRecord(Record existingRecord)
Add an existing Record to the table, for example when populating the table from a database file. The Record will not be written to file.

Parameters:
existingRecord - the Record to add

addModifiedRecord

void addModifiedRecord(Record newRecord)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Add a Record to the table, and write it to file. If there is an existing Record with the same record number, it will be overwritten.

Parameters:
newRecord - the Record to add
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the Record could not be written to file

createRecord

Record createRecord(java.util.List<Field> fields)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Create a Record from the given fields, and add it to the table. The new Record will be written to the database file, possibly reusing the number of a deleted Record. The new Record will not be marked as deleted.

Parameters:
fields - the fields of the Record to be created
Returns:
the newly created Record
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the Record could not be written to file

getRecord

Record getRecord(int recordNumber)
Get the Record with the given number, or null if not found.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number
Returns:
the Record with the given number

getAllRecords

java.util.Collection<LockableRecord> getAllRecords()
Get all the records, together with their locks. The collection returned may not reflect changes to records that occur while the method is being performed.

Returns:
all the records and their locks

getSchema

TableSchema getSchema()
Get the schema for this Table.

Returns:
the table schema

getFieldParsers

FieldParsers getFieldParsers()
Get the parsers for the fields in this Table.

Returns:
the field parsers

addToDeleteList

void addToDeleteList(int recordNumber)
Add the record number of a deleted Record to the delete list so that the number can be reused when a new Record is created.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number of the deleted Record

shutDown

void shutDown()
Shuts down the Table gracefully, ensuring that the data file does not become corrupted.
